blocks.name: cclwwlk
blocks.content: Extend class notation with closed walks (in an undirected graph) as word over the set of vertices.
blocks.origin: const class cclwwlk { ClWWalks }

blocks.name: diff.cclwwlk.s
diff.cclwwlk.c
diff.cclwwlk.w
df-clwwlk
blocks.content: Define the set of all closed walks (in an undirected graph) as words over the set of vertices. Such a word corresponds to the sequence p(0) p(1) ... p(n-1) of the vertices in a closed walk p(0) e(f(1)) p(1) e(f(2)) ... p(n-1) e(f(n)) p(n)=p(0) as defined in ~ df-clwlks . Notice that the word does not contain the terminating vertex p(n) of the walk, because it is always equal to the first vertex of the closed walk. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 20-Mar-2018.) (Revised by AV, 24-Apr-2021.)

thm clwwlk(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ‚ä¢ (ClWWalks ` c0)= { s0 ‚àà Word(c1)|(s0 ‚â† ‚àÖ ‚àß ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà(0[..^]((# ` s0)[-]1)), {(s0 ` s1),(s0 `(s1[+]1))} ‚àà c2)‚àß {(lastS ` s0),(s0 ` 0)} ‚àà c2)}
  ‚ä£ c1 =(Vtx ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c2 =(Edg ` c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
} = {
  pm2.61i((ClWWalks ` c0)= { s0 ‚àà Word(c1)|(s0 ‚â† ‚àÖ ‚àß ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà(0[..^]((# ` s0)[-]1)), {(s0 ` s1),(s0 `(s1[+]1))} ‚àà c2)‚àß {(lastS ` s0),(s0 ` 0)} ‚àà c2)}, c0 ‚àà ùïå)
  fvmptd3(hs0, cclwwlk, c0, { s0 ‚àà Word(c1)|(s0 ‚â† ‚àÖ ‚àß ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà(0[..^]((# ` s0)[-]1)), {(s0 ` s1),(s0 `(s1[+]1))} ‚àà c2)‚àß {(lastS ` s0),(s0 ` 0)} ‚àà c2)}, universe, { s0 ‚àà Word((Vtx ` hs0))|(s0 ‚â† ‚àÖ ‚àß ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà(0[..^]((# ` s0)[-]1)), {(s0 ` s1),(s0 `(s1[+]1))} ‚àà(Edg ` hs0))‚àß {(lastS ` s0),(s0 ` 0)} ‚àà(Edg ` hs0))}, universe, c0 ‚àà ùïå)
  df-clwwlk(hs0, s0, s1)
  rabeqbidv(s0, Word((Vtx ` hs0)), Word(c1), hs0 = c0, (s0 ‚â† ‚àÖ ‚àß ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà(0[..^]((# ` s0)[-]1)), {(s0 ` s1),(s0 `(s1[+]1))} ‚àà(Edg ` hs0))‚àß {(lastS ` s0),(s0 ` 0)} ‚àà(Edg ` hs0)), (s0 ‚â† ‚àÖ ‚àß ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà(0[..^]((# ` s0)[-]1)), {(s0 ` s1),(s0 `(s1[+]1))} ‚àà c2)‚àß {(lastS ` s0),(s0 ` 0)} ‚àà c2))
  syl(hs0 = c0, Word((Vtx ` hs0))= Word(c1), (Vtx ` hs0)= c1)
  syl6eqr((Vtx ` hs0), c1, (Vtx ` c0), hs0 = c0)
  fveq2(hs0, c0, cvtx)
  wrdeq((Vtx ` hs0), c1)
  3anbi23d(hs0 = c0, s0 ‚â† ‚àÖ, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà(0[..^]((# ` s0)[-]1)), {(s0 ` s1),(s0 `(s1[+]1))} ‚àà(Edg ` hs0)), {(lastS ` s0),(s0 ` 0)} ‚àà(Edg ` hs0), ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà(0[..^]((# ` s0)[-]1)), {(s0 ` s1),(s0 `(s1[+]1))} ‚àà c2), {(lastS ` s0),(s0 ` 0)} ‚àà c2)
  ralbidv(s1, (0[..^]((# ` s0)[-]1)), hs0 = c0, {(s0 ` s1),(s0 `(s1[+]1))} ‚àà(Edg ` hs0), {(s0 ` s1),(s0 `(s1[+]1))} ‚àà c2)
  eleq2d({(s0 ` s1),(s0 `(s1[+]1))}, (Edg ` hs0), c2, hs0 = c0)
  eleq2d({(lastS ` s0),(s0 ` 0)}, (Edg ` hs0), c2, hs0 = c0)
  syl6eqr((Edg ` hs0), c2, (Edg ` c0), hs0 = c0)
  fveq2(hs0, c0, cedg)
  id(c0 ‚àà ùïå)
  3syl(c0 ‚àà ùïå, { s0 ‚àà Word(c1)|(s0 ‚â† ‚àÖ ‚àß ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà(0[..^]((# ` s0)[-]1)), {(s0 ` s1),(s0 `(s1[+]1))} ‚àà c2)‚àß {(lastS ` s0),(s0 ` 0)} ‚àà c2)} ‚àà ùïå, c1 ‚àà ùïå, Word(c1)‚àà ùïå)
  a1i(c0 ‚àà ùïå, c1 ‚àà ùïå)
  fvexi(c1, cvtx, c0)
  wrdexg(c1, universe)
  rabexg(s0, Word(c1), universe, (s0 ‚â† ‚àÖ ‚àß ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà(0[..^]((# ` s0)[-]1)), {(s0 ` s1),(s0 `(s1[+]1))} ‚àà c2)‚àß {(lastS ` s0),(s0 ` 0)} ‚àà c2))
  eqtr4d((ClWWalks ` c0), { s0 ‚àà Word(c1)|(s0 ‚â† ‚àÖ ‚àß ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà(0[..^]((# ` s0)[-]1)), {(s0 ` s1),(s0 `(s1[+]1))} ‚àà c2)‚àß {(lastS ` s0),(s0 ` 0)} ‚àà c2)}, emptycls, ¬¨ c0 ‚àà ùïå)
  fvprc(c0, cclwwlk)
  sylibr(¬¨ c0 ‚àà ùïå, { s0 ‚àà Word(c1)|(s0 ‚â† ‚àÖ ‚àß ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà(0[..^]((# ` s0)[-]1)), {(s0 ` s1),(s0 `(s1[+]1))} ‚àà c2)‚àß {(lastS ` s0),(s0 ` 0)} ‚àà c2)} = ‚àÖ, ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà Word(c1), ¬¨(s0 ‚â† ‚àÖ ‚àß ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà(0[..^]((# ` s0)[-]1)), {(s0 ` s1),(s0 `(s1[+]1))} ‚àà c2)‚àß {(lastS ` s0),(s0 ` 0)} ‚àà c2)))
  ralrimiva(s0, Word(c1), ¬¨ c0 ‚àà ùïå, ¬¨(s0 ‚â† ‚àÖ ‚àß ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà(0[..^]((# ` s0)[-]1)), {(s0 ` s1),(s0 `(s1[+]1))} ‚àà c2)‚àß {(lastS ` s0),(s0 ` 0)} ‚àà c2))
  intn3an3d((¬¨ c0 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß s0 ‚àà Word(c1)), s0 ‚â† ‚àÖ, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà(0[..^]((# ` s0)[-]1)), {(s0 ` s1),(s0 `(s1[+]1))} ‚àà c2), {(lastS ` s0),(s0 ` 0)} ‚àà c2)
  adantr(¬¨ c0 ‚àà ùïå, s0 ‚àà Word(c1), ¬¨ {(lastS ` s0),(s0 ` 0)} ‚àà c2)
  mtbiri(¬¨ c0 ‚àà ùïå, {(lastS ` s0),(s0 ` 0)} ‚àà c2, {(lastS ` s0),(s0 ` 0)} ‚àà ‚àÖ)
  noel({(lastS ` s0),(s0 ` 0)})
  eleq2d({(lastS ` s0),(s0 ` 0)}, c2, emptycls, ¬¨ c0 ‚àà ùïå)
  syl5eq(c2, emptycls, (Edg ` c0), ¬¨ c0 ‚àà ùïå)
  fvprc(c0, cedg)
  rabeq0(s0, Word(c1), (s0 ‚â† ‚àÖ ‚àß ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà(0[..^]((# ` s0)[-]1)), {(s0 ` s1),(s0 `(s1[+]1))} ‚àà c2)‚àß {(lastS ` s0),(s0 ` 0)} ‚àà c2))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c({ s0 ‚àà Word(c1)|(s0 ‚â† ‚àÖ ‚àß ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà(0[..^]((# ` s0)[-]1)), {(s0 ` s1),(s0 `(s1[+]1))} ‚àà c2)‚àß {(lastS ` s0),(s0 ` 0)} ‚àà c2)})
  diff.hs0.c(universe)
  diff.cword.s(s0, (Vtx ` hs0))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cvtx, hs0)
  diff.cvtx.s(s0)
  diff.cword.s(s0, c1)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs0, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, hs0, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.wn.s(s0, c0 ‚àà ùïå)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, universe)
  diff.universe.s(s0)
}

blocks.content: Properties of a word to represent a closed walk (in an undirected graph). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 20-Mar-2018.) (Revised by AV, 24-Apr-2021.)

thm isclwwlk(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, cfv(cclwwlk, c1)), w3a(wa(wcel(c0, cword(c2)), wne(c0, emptycls)), wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, co(cfv(chash, c0), cmin, nat1)), wcel(cpr(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), cfv(c0, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), c3)), wcel(cpr(cfv(clsw, c0), cfv(c0, nat0)), c3)))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cvtx, c1))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cedg, c1))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)

blocks.name: clwwlkbp
blocks.content: Basic properties of a closed walk (in an undirected graph) as word. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 15-Mar-2018.) (Revised by AV, 24-Apr-2021.)

blocks.name: clwwlkgt0
blocks.content: There is no empty closed walk (i.e. a closed walk without any edge) represented by a word of vertices. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 15-Sep-2018.) (Revised by AV, 24-Apr-2021.)

blocks.name: clwwlksswrd
blocks.content: Closed walks (represented by words) are words. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 25-Mar-2018.) (Revised by AV, 25-Apr-2021.)

blocks.name: clwwlk1loop
blocks.content: A closed walk of length 1 is a loop. See also ~ clwlkl1loop . (Contributed by AV, 24-Apr-2021.)

blocks.name: clwwlkccat
blocks.content: The concatenation of two words representing closed walks anchored at the same vertex represents a closed walk. The resulting walk is a "double loop", starting at the common vertex, coming back to the common vertex by the first walk, following the second walk and finally coming back to the common vertex again. (Contributed by AV, 23-Apr-2022.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.content: A closed walk in a multigraph has a length of at least 2 (because it cannot have a loop). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 16-Sep-2018.) (Revised by AV, 24-Apr-2021.)

blocks.name: clwlkclwwlk
blocks.content: A closed walk as word of length at least 2 corresponds to a closed walk in a simple pseudograph. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 22-Jun-2018.) (Revised by AV, 24-Apr-2021.) (Revised by AV, 30-Oct-2022.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: clwlkclwwlk2
blocks.content: A closed walk corresponds to a closed walk as word in a simple pseudograph. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 22-Jun-2018.) (Revised by AV, 24-Apr-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 2-Nov-2022.)
blocks.origin:

  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)

blocks.name: clwlkclwwlkfo

blocks.name: clwlkclwwlkf1o
blocks.content: ` F ` is a bijection between the nonempty closed walks and the closed walks as words in a simple pseudograph. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 5-Jul-2018.) (Revised by AV, 3-May-2021.) (Revised by AV, 29-Oct-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm clwlkclwwlkf1o(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cuspgr), wf1o(c1, c2, cfv(cclwwlk, c0)))
  -| wceq(c2, crab(s0, cfv(cclwlks, c0), wbr(nat1, cle, cfv(chash, cfv(c1st, cv(s0))))))
  -| wceq(c1, cmpt(s1, c2, co(cfv(c2nd, cv(s1)), cpfx, co(cfv(chash, cfv(c2nd, cv(s1))), cmin, nat1))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
} = {
  sylanbrc(wcel(c0, cuspgr), wf1o(c1, c2, cfv(cclwwlk, c0)), wf1(c1, c2, cfv(cclwwlk, c0)), wfo(c1, c2, cfv(cclwwlk, c0)))
  clwlkclwwlkf1(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2)
  clwlkclwwlkfo(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2)
  df-f1o(c1, c2, cfv(cclwwlk, c0))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm clwlkclwwlkf1o(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà USPGraph ‚Üí(c1 : c2 ‚Üî(ClWWalks ` c0)))
  ‚ä£ c2 = { s0 ‚àà(ClWalks ` c0)| 1[‚â§](# `(1st ` s0))}
  ‚ä£ c1 =(s1 ‚àà c2 ‚Ü¶((2nd ` s1)[prefix]((# `(2nd ` s1))[-]1)))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c2)
} = {
  sylanbrc(c0 ‚àà USPGraph, (c1 : c2 ‚Üî(ClWWalks ` c0)), (c1 : c2 ‚Ü£(ClWWalks ` c0)), (c1 : c2 ‚Ü†(ClWWalks ` c0)))
  clwlkclwwlkf1(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2)
  clwlkclwwlkfo(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2)
  df-f1o(c1, c2, (ClWWalks ` c0))
}

blocks.name: clwwisshclwws
blocks.content: Cyclically shifting a closed walk as word results in a closed walk as word (in an undirected graph). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 24-Mar-2018.) (Revised by AV, 28-Apr-2021.)

blocks.name: clwwisshclwwsn
blocks.content: Cyclically shifting a closed walk as word results in a closed walk as word (in an undirected graph). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 15-Jun-2018.) (Revised by AV, 29-Apr-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm clwwisshclwwsn(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cclwwlk, c1)), wcel(c2, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)))), wcel(co(c0, ccsh, c2), cfv(cclwwlk, c1)))
} = {
  pm2.61ian(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cclwwlk, c1)), wcel(c2, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)))), wcel(co(c0, ccsh, c2), cfv(cclwwlk, c1)), wceq(c2, cfv(chash, c0)))
  eqeltrd(co(c0, ccsh, c2), cfv(cclwwlk, c1), c0, wa(wceq(c2, cfv(chash, c0)), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cclwwlk, c1)), wcel(c2, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0))))))
  sylan9eq(co(c0, ccsh, c2), c0, co(c0, ccsh, cfv(chash, c0)), wceq(c2, cfv(chash, c0)), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cclwwlk, c1)), wcel(c2, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)))))
  oveq2(c2, cfv(chash, c0), c0, ccsh)
  adantr(wcel(c0, cfv(cclwwlk, c1)), wcel(c2, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0))), wceq(co(c0, ccsh, cfv(chash, c0)), c0))
  syl(wcel(c0, cfv(cclwwlk, c1)), wceq(co(c0, ccsh, cfv(chash, c0)), c0), wcel(c0, cword(cfv(cvtx, c1))))
  simp2d(wcel(c0, cfv(cclwwlk, c1)), wcel(c0, cword(cfv(cvtx, c1))), wcel(c1, universe), wne(c0, emptycls))
  clwwlkbp(c0, c1, cfv(cvtx, c1))
  eqid(cfv(cvtx, c1))
  cshwn(c0, cfv(cvtx, c1))
  simprl(wceq(c2, cfv(chash, c0)), wcel(c0, cfv(cclwwlk, c1)), wcel(c2, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0))))
  syl2anc(wa(wn(wceq(c2, cfv(chash, c0))), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cclwwlk, c1)), wcel(c2, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0))))), wcel(co(c0, ccsh, c2), cfv(cclwwlk, c1)), wcel(c0, cfv(cclwwlk, c1)), wcel(c2, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0))))
  simprl(wn(wceq(c2, cfv(chash, c0))), wcel(c0, cfv(cclwwlk, c1)), wcel(c2, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0))))
  impcom(wn(wceq(c2, cfv(chash, c0))), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cclwwlk, c1)), wcel(c2, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)))), wcel(c2, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0))))
  adantl(wcel(c0, cfv(cclwwlk, c1)), wcel(c2, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0))), wi(wn(wceq(c2, cfv(chash, c0))), wcel(c2, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)))))
  syl5bir(wcel(c2, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0))), wn(wceq(c2, cfv(chash, c0))), wcel(c2, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0))), wne(c2, cfv(chash, c0)))

blocks.name: erclwwlktr
blocks.content: ` .~ ` is a transitive relation over the set of closed walks (defined as words). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 10-Apr-2018.) (Revised by AV, 30-Apr-2021.)

blocks.name: erclwwlk
blocks.content: ` .~ ` is an equivalence relation over the set of closed walks (defined as words). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 10-Apr-2018.) (Revised by AV, 30-Apr-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm erclwwlk(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wer(c0, cfv(cclwwlk, c1))
  -| wceq(c0, copab(s0, s1, w3a(wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cclwwlk, c1)), wcel(cv(s1), cfv(cclwwlk, c1)), wrex(s2, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s0), co(cv(s1), ccsh, cv(s2)))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
} = {
  iseri(hs0, hs1, hs2, c0, cfv(cclwwlk, c1))
  erclwwlkrel(s0, s1, s2, c0, c1)
  erclwwlksym(hs0, hs1, s0, s1, s2, c0, c1)
  erclwwlktr(hs0, hs1, hs2, s0, s1, s2, c0, c1)
  erclwwlkref(hs0, s0, s1, s2, c1, c0)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs2)
  diff.hs1.s(hs2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cclwwlk, c1))
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs2.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.s(s2)
  diff.hs1.s(s0)
  diff.hs1.s(s1)
  diff.hs1.s(s2)
  diff.hs2.s(s0)
  diff.hs2.s(s1)
  diff.hs2.s(s2)
}
